data.title: Good Family Place
data.text: We've lived by Los Arcos for 3 yrs. & never visited this restaurant because we didn't know if it was good. After an exausting weekend doing a garage sale, we decided to give it a chance. The food was good, service was fast, prices were cheap, & our waiter, Steve was awesome. Very nice surprise, & my husband is picky, & left happy & full.

data.title: Never Disappoints
data.text: Los Arcos never disappoints. The atmosphere, the service and the food are always stellar and authentic. My husband and I joined a friend for dinner Friday night. I had the sizzling fajitas with shrimp and was very happy with the flavors, not to mention the size of the shrimp. The restaurant was also treated to a seven person mariachis band. It was a lot of fun.

data.title: True Mexican Fare
data.text: The reception, service, and quality/ quantity of servings on all meals served here are all 10+, delicious and quite filling. You are greeted, seated, and immediately serviced with a great staff, and quenched if thirsty, as well as their salsa/ chips are tasty, while your meal is freshly prepared with all the quality one would expect from and experienced cuisine such as this. ( oth er locations as well). They are well known in the area by the locals, and are a g re at place to bring family and friends for an ambient atmosphere, and a satisfying meal. Highly recommended.

data.title: Yummy 🍽
data.text: Food was good. Service was fast.  I've been here several times and I've never been disappointed.  Staff is always friendly. 🌯🌮

data.title: Great extra hot sauces
data.text: I had dinner at Los Arcos with a coworker. When we pulled up to the restaurant we knew the food would be good, the lot was almost full. Never eat at a place with an empty parking lot. The food was very good and reasonably priced. The thing I enjoyed most was the sauces. I asked for extra hot and they had a couple great homemade offerings. I especially liked the spicy salsa verde.

data.title: Good Solid Mexican Food
data.text: This is a good solid Mexican restaurant.  Its a good value for what you get.  Not the best, but solid.  It has plenty of seating and a nice patio as well.

data.title: Yep yep
data.text: Excellent green chili, chili rellenos, fajitas, carnitas, and out of this world margaritas... all in one well priced package... love it

data.title: Always good!
data.text: Consistently delicious food,  and friendly, courteous and fast service. The family that owns it has been doing it well for years now! Great for lunch or dinner.

data.title: Yum, Good Stuff
data.text:
Los Arcos is a Family friendly place with great food. Tacos, Burritos, Steak, All excellent.
Decently priced and tasty Margaritas!

data.title: Great food and atmosphere!
data.text: Got take out which was excellent.  Stopped in for a fine margarita and listened to the mariachi band.  You can tell by the crowds that this place is legit.

owner_response.author: CJ R, Public Relations Manager at Los Arcos Mexican Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Always a Great Meal
data.text: Since moving out of state, we don't get to experience this wonderful restaurant enough.  However, whenever we are in the area, we must go there or our trip is not complete.  It is always an amazing experience to eat here.  The atmosphere is warm and inviting as is the wait staff, but the food is consistantly good.  We now live in South Texas where there are plenty of Mexican restaurants, but none can compare with Los Arcos!  Hubby's favorite is the Milanessa.  I enjoy a variety, but especially the Crispy Rellanos smothered in the green chili.  Margaritas are outstanding as well.   Wish we could package this place and take it back with us.

data.title: Best Green Chili and Mexican Food in Colorado!!!!
data.text:
Los Arcos is Amazing.  If you are looking for quality Mexican Food this is the place.  I have been eating here for 25 plus years and it seems to get better every time I visit.  First, They are Known for their Margarita's, Green Chili, Fajitas, and the Chili Rellenos!  I looked at some of the reviews here and was shocked by some of the negative reviews. The Green Chili is very flavorful and not too hot. It has a kick, but you can still feel your lips and face after eating it.  The chili rellenos are wrapped in an egg roll and then deep fried.  This is the best way to have them. Other Mexican restaurants dip them in an egg batter and fry them, but I prefer the egg roll deep fried style Los Arcos has.  

The restaurant is a family owned location and has been in Westminster for over 30 Plus years.  Yes, it's busy on the weekend's but honestly the longest my family of four has ever waited for a table was about 30-35 minutes to be seated on a weekend between the 6:00pm-7:30pm time slot.  Best time to go on the weekends would be at Lunch Time so around 11:00am-1:00pm or anytime before 5:00pm on the weekends if you want to avoid a wait. But trust me it's worth the wait.  Free homemade chips and homemade salsa at the table while you wait to order.  I don't eat red chili, but the green Chili is better than any other chili I have had in the state of Colorado. And I have eaten at a lot of Mexican restaurants in Colorado. 
They have a Mariachi band that plays on Friday Nights, and they are great.  
This is truly a Gem of a restaurant in the Westminster area, and I would Highly recommend this to any one who is looking for quality Mexican food.  

Also, despite some other post's, the prices for the meals are fair. Usually my wife and I and our two kids can eat dinner with soft drinks and tip typically for under thirty dollars.  
Trust me when I say you will not be disappointed in the food quality or the restaurant atmosphere.  Do yourself a favor and eat there you will go back again, it's that good!
The only other two menu items I would 100% recommend is the Chili Cheese Fries, and the Fried Ice Cream. They are fantastic!

Final Note, this is a mid range style family restaurant and is very family friendly.  For non locals who are traveling, I would recommend coming here for dinner after your Visit to Water World as it's about a 10 Minute drive from Water World to Los Arcos Westminster.

data.title: Excellent food!!
data.text: Really enjoyed the food here, and the service was excellent. The decor was tired and not as nice as the food or service, but it didn't affect having a great meal here one bit. Would definitely recommend.

data.title: great food
data.text:
very good mexican food that is served quickly 
we have been regular customers of Los Arcos for 20+ years

data.title: Cinco de Mayo disappointment
data.text:
Someone at our hotel recommended this place. Unfortunately, the food had very little seasoning (except salt) and was not on par with some superb Mexican restaurants I have experienced in San Antonio, Amarillo and Albuquerque. 
Our server (Sam) was being trained by Ashlee, and they both provided excellent service. My wife and I split a combination platter which included a tamale, a crispy chile relleno and a cheese/onion enchilada. The tamale was not recognizable, the chile relleno was good and spicy, and the enchilada seemed somewhat seasoned. Overall, however, we could not detect much in the way of chili powder, garlic or onion or "heat" (except salt). 
We had to have Sam re-heat the dinner, as it was initially served lukewarm. We also had to have the tostados replaced with fresh ones, as the first basket tasted burned. The salsa was watered down, and had very little flavor. I cannot recommend this place, and we will not be back.

data.title: Consistent Quality!
data.text: This is a great place for Colorado style Mexican food! They strive for great service and delicious food. Every time. Year after year.

data.title: OK - Not Overly Impressive
data.text: We went on a Saturday evening, and it was very busy as we assumed it would be.  The margaritas were very good but pricey.  The food was better than I expected, and plenty of it.  I had the enchiladas and they were very good.  Our server Angel was awesome, but the poor guy was running from one end of the building to the other.  Either there was insufficient staff, which would be surprising for Saturday, or tables were assigned in no good order.  The atmosphere was cheery but very loud.

data.title: Average
data.text: Didn't care for the food, no flavor and everything tastes the same which is bland. Service was mediocre and our family didn't like it as a whole.

data.title: No, Thanks, we won't be back
data.text: This place is always packed.  Always.  And, I just don't understand why.  The food is bland.  Service was okay, there was plenty on the plate, the place appears to be clean, but everything is blah.  I think it must be for people who don't enjoy any spice in their food but can still say they eat Mexican?

data.title: Excellent-will return!
data.text:
Great atmosphere, food, drinks, service with the added bonus of Mariachis playing during our dinner.

Definitely a go-to spot when we travel to the Denver area.

owner_response.author: CJ R, Public Relations Manager at Los Arcos Mexican Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for a great review Stefani374! ~ Please come back next time you're in town.
owner_response.title: Owner Response
